page.title: 04EDUCATION AROUND BROMYARD
page.content: There are now only two{Primary {Schools}in the area as many small rural schools have merged. {Brockhampton School}situated on the Downs now has 5 teachers and 125 pupils.{St.Peter's}now occupies the old Grammar School site in Bromyard. It was extended in 1971. There are 11 teachers and 298 pupils, which includes those at the nursery school. Bromyard's Grammar School closed in 1968 and amalgamated with a Secondary Modern School to form{Queen Elizabeth {High School,}a 500-pupil 11-16 years comprehensive. Pupils transfer here from 6 primary schools and travel by school bus. Out of school activities are therefore usually held at lunchtimes. The modern buildings are situated on the outskirts of the town and it has its own sports facilities and gardens.
